organization.name: Kenya Keys
organization.primary_focus: Education access and student empowerment in rural Kenya
organization.core_belief: Education is the foundation for improving lives, families, and communities

mission_and_vision.mission: To remove barriers to education by supporting students from low-income backgrounds with access to secondary and post-secondary education, while providing holistic support beyond school fees.
mission_and_vision.vision: To create long-term, generational change by empowering educated individuals to become self-reliant leaders and contributors within their communities.

beneficiaries: Girls and boys facing economic hardship

education_sponsorship.description: Pairs students with sponsors to cover school fees and essential education-related costs.
education_sponsorship.duration: Up to 3 years of secondary school and 1–4 years of post-secondary education

student_support_services.description: Provides non-tuition support to ensure student retention and success.

community_programs.description: Community-based initiatives that promote education, literacy, and self-reliance.

learning_center_and_library.name: Community Education Center
learning_center_and_library.purpose: Serve as a regional hub for education, technology, and community learning.
features: Computer learning lab with internet access

impact.students_supported: Nearly 1,000 students supported over multiple years
graduation_outcomes: Strong transition from secondary to post-secondary education
impact.gender_focus: Significant emphasis on supporting girls’ education
long_term_effects: Improved local economic and social outcomes

organizational_structure.operations: Led and implemented by local Kenyan leadership and staff

geographic_presence.operational_area: Kwale County and surrounding rural communities
